text.section:
The governing body of Talbot County or of a municipal corporation in Talbot County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on:
property that is owned by the Chesapeake Audubon Society, Inc. and is used solely for:
the environmental education of the public; and
the maintenance of:
a natural area for public use; or
a sanctuary for wildlife; and
personal property that is:
owned by Chesapeake Wildlife Heritage, Incorporated;
used primarily for the purpose of the organization; and
not used primarily for revenue or income-producing purposes.

section.section:
The governing body of Talbot County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is:
owned or occupied by a commercial or industrial business that is currently or will be doing business in Talbot County; and
new construction or a substantial improvement to the real property.

The governing body of Talbot County may:
set, by law, the amount, terms, scope, and duration of a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection;
adopt any provision necessary to administer a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
provide for any other restriction or condition considered desirable on the granting of a credit under paragraph (1) of this subsection.

The governing body of Talbot County or of a municipal corporation in Talbot County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on personal property.

The governing body of Talbot County or of a municipal corporation in Talbot County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax that is imposed on real property that is:
owned by Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc. with the intention of relinquishing ownership in the immediate future;
used exclusively for the purpose of rehabilitation and transfer to a private owner; and
not occupied by administrative or warehouse buildings owned by Habitat for Humanity.

Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc. shall submit an annual written report to the governing body of Talbot County documenting:
all of Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc.'s real property holdings in Talbot County; and
all transactions involving Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc.'s real property holdings in Talbot County.

The governing body of Talbot County or of a municipal corporation in Talbot County may, by law:
set the amount, terms, scope, and duration of a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
adopt any provision necessary to administer a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection.
